Description: Rim fragment of large pottery black-figured bowl. White slip. Interior glazed with one added red band lined in white preserved. Outside: at lip band of alternating red and black short tongues above band; below, parts of two black-figure swans to left; rosettes and other fill in the field.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Robinson 1893 / Catalogue of Greek, Etruscan and Roman Vases (p. 224, no. 109)
Fairbanks 1928 / Early Vases preceding Athenian Black Figure Ware (p. 106, pl. XXXIII, no. 316.2)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.991)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Museum of Fine Arts, Boston
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: P.4679 (Pottery & Porcelain Ledger No.)
